stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on polishing the RTYI engine based on recent Only-Up 64 play-test data, implements a new ‘cement-Koopa’ Easter egg, and prototypes the Oil-Rig (Course 11) Wiggler overseer NPC while discussing physics, camera, and performance tweaks.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wants to ship “one or two more hacks on the RTYI engine before RTYI is released” to gather more data and refine systems.
development_findings.quote: We should make like one or two more hacks on the RTYI engine before RTYI is released just to get everything a little bit improved.

development_findings.summary: A memory leak tied to ‘condition triangles’ is causing crashes; outer-rotate force and several physics values were reduced to stabilise things.
development_findings.quote: What's leaking memory? Too many condition triangles, so I reduced the outer rotate force and I changed a lot of the physics.

development_findings.summary: Ceiling behaviour rewritten: diving into a ceiling now ‘bonks’ unless Mario’s momentum matches the ceiling angle, eliminating a double-ceiling exploit.
development_findings.quote: I changed ceiling interactions so now you just bonk if you dive into a ceiling... there's no longer a way to get like another ceiling which is very helpful.

development_findings.summary: Warp logic will be changed so Mario keeps his current action and the stick auto-holds toward the warp, preventing visual oddities at 60 FPS.
development_findings.quote: Instead what's gonna happen is that Mario is holding the stick towards the warp and Mario's normal actions are just gonna continue while the warp is happening.

development_findings.summary: Input-lag complaints stem from players switching between 60 FPS emulation and 30 FPS N64; Kaze says true lag is lower at 60 FPS but rewriting physics to 60 FPS would be a major undertaking.
development_findings.quote: Yes, but I would also have to rewrite all of Mario's physics to be in 60fps – not really a very reasonable thing to do.

development_findings.summary: All physics, camera, and ‘magic numbers’ have been moved into a single header with #defines and comments for easy tuning, inspired by practices at Gears for Breakfast.
development_findings.quote: I took notes from how we work in Gears for Breakfast and decided I will make all the magic numbers into defines in this file and I even added comments.

development_findings.summary: Created ‘dirtiness’ system for Builder Koopa cement: samples 93 texture pixels diagonally (increment 176) to approximate coverage, triggers crying animation/dialogue when threshold (~40 k) met, cutting per-frame cost ~15×.
development_findings.quote: Doesn't this look perfect? We just cut computation costs into like... basically a 15th.

development_findings.summary: Oil-Rig Wiggler overseer design: stands at rig centre, turns progressively red after each worker is sabotaged, then runs the catwalk and despawns; explicitly not a boss fight.
development_findings.quote: After you mess with everyone the Wiggler just says ‘Okay I've had enough of this’… and then he just disappears. This guy is not a boss fight.

development_findings.summary: Model philosophy: keep triangle counts low; Kaze criticises 2013-15 trend of bragging about 50k-poly levels and prefers efficiency for N64.
development_findings.quote: You could make it look the exact same with like 10,000. Why are you talking about that like that's an achievement?

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently moved to Canada, jokes he’s ‘rich now’, and complains that shipping (e.g., Yu-Gi-Oh cards) costs as much as the items.
context_findings.quote: Now that I'm living in Canada and I'm rich and all I wanna get some Yu-Gi-Oh cards… shipping to Canada is almost as expensive as the item itself.

context_findings.summary: He abandoned Twitch for YouTube because of intrusive ads and wants a smaller, project-focused chat.
context_findings.quote: Twitch is just so many ads… I decided it is time to leave. I kinda want to filter this chat to only be the people that actually care about the project.

context_findings.summary: Considers paying for Twitter Blue purely for ad-share revenue but dislikes the blue-check stigma.
context_findings.quote: I want the money, but I don't want to pay for Twitter Blue… now I have the blue checkmark and I look like a fucking idiot.

context_findings.summary: States optimisation is his speciality but others know more low-level N64; values readable, self-contained code over comments.
context_findings.quote: I think I'm the best optimisation guy, but just general N64? Nope, that ain't me.

biobak.summary: Offers model help, suggests simplifying feet and retaining legs, and provides feedback on Wiggler vest ideas.
biobak.quote: Let me get some point I can help you with some models since I'm a little more confident in my skills now.

badub.summary: Badub’s new Oil-Rig track (with mechanical sounds) is finished but not yet public; Kaze plays an internal version off-stream.

zeina.summary: Creates idle penguin flapping animation, then quickly produces a looping crying animation for Builder Koopa; will add Wiggler animations next.
zeina.quote: Okay, let's make this builder Koopa cry… Can you do that real quick? – I can try, yeah.

key_stories.title: Cement-Koopa Easter Egg
key_stories.summary: Players can ruin a Koopa’s freshly laid cement. Kaze needed an efficient way to measure ‘messiness’ without scanning the whole texture each frame.
key_stories.challenge: Full image sampling was too slow for N64.
key_stories.process: Selected 93 evenly spaced pixels (increment 176) to approximate coverage and tuned a 40 k threshold; Zeina added a crying animation.
key_stories.outcome: Works smoothly on hardware; Koopa’s dialogue and pose change, rewarding curious players.
key_stories.key_quote: We just cut computation costs into like a 15th.

key_stories.title: Wiggler Overseer Concept
key_stories.summary: Designing a non-combat Wiggler who manages an oil rig. As Mario sabotages four workers, Wiggler’s colour and dialogue escalate.
key_stories.challenge: Conveying anger progression and final retreat without becoming a boss fight.
key_stories.process: Iterated on model size, hats, arm design; planned cut-scenes and colour-shift shader; Zeina to animate.
key_stories.outcome: Behaviour scripted, model partially complete; animations pending.
key_stories.key_quote: He’s the overseer… he’s gonna get more red and so on until eventually you messed with all four people.

key_stories.title: Switch from Twitch to YouTube
key_stories.summary: Kaze moved all live streams after frustration with Twitch ads and to cultivate a more focused audience.
key_stories.challenge: Twitch’s increasing ad load hurt both his viewing experience and community vibe.
key_stories.process: Set up YouTube streams, keeps VODs on ‘Kaze Clips’, explores Super Chat monetisation.
key_stories.outcome: Immediate higher Super Chat revenue and better chat culture.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm streaming on YouTube now… Twitch has so many ads that I just don't like it anymore.
